page.title: 05HOUSING IN TEDDINGTON
page.content: The area to the{south of Teddington {centre is mainly housing. Queen's {Road}is used as a by-pass route around the centre and{Park Road}is the main street south from the railway bridge. Both{are busy,}especially during the rush hour{but off them are a number of {peaceful residential streets.} Most of {the houses are semi-detached and}were built during the{late Edwardian period. {Off Queen's Road}and behind the main street{are 12 blocks of flats. }These were{built in the 1960's-1970's. Several of the{roads in the immediate {vicinity of the station were developed when the railway came to Teddington in {the middle of the 19th. century}and these have royal names from that age: Albert, Adelaide, Clarence and Victoria Roads.
